tightfisted_agent.goal: Describe the tightfisted action in a precise structured form so an orchestrator can convert it into PDDL-compatible predicates, parameters, preconditions, and effects.

private_information: role: audit temporal and causal consistency
capability: detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or transient bookkeeping predicates that do not correspond to true state changes
task: examine structured action descriptions and initial/goal statements and indicate required normalization steps and removal of bookkeeping artifacts to ensure a clean STRIPS-compatible model
auditor.goal: Audit the structured action descriptions and initial/goal statements, report causal or temporal inconsistencies, and provide a normalized set of predicates and rules that remove bookkeeping shortcuts so the orchestrator can produce a sound PDDL domain and problem.

private_information: role: integrate action descriptions and audit recommendations into a final PDDL domain and problem
requirements: ensure actions remain distinct per originating agent to preserve agent-level separation while producing a single domain and one or more problem files as needed
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes the actions, the normalized predicates, the provided initial conditions and goals from the use-case, and validates temporal/causal consistency.

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
Predicates used across actions: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, collect, spring, stupendous
There are several initial condition statements and goals described for different scenarios in the use-case that must be representable by the domain

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert on the 'memory' action. Produce a concise structured JSON-like description listing parameters, preconditions, add_effects, and del_effects using only your private information and the environment public information. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the memory action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert on the 'sip' action. Produce a concise structured JSON-like description listing parameters, preconditions, add_effects, and del_effects using only your private information and the environment public information. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the sip action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the paltry action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the clip action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert on the 'wretched' action. Produce a concise structured JSON-like description listing parameters, preconditions, add_effects, and del_effects using only your private information and the environment public information. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the wretched action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert on the 'tightfisted' action. Produce a concise structured JSON-like description listing parameters, preconditions, add_effects, and del_effects using only your private information and the environment public information. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Provide a structured description of the tightfisted action usable by an orchestrator: include typed parameter names, a complete listing of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and note any implicit assumptions or potential normalization suggestions.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor whose role is to check temporal and causal consistency and to remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts. Examine the structured action descriptions and report normalization steps and any removed bookkeeping predicates so that the orchestrator can generate a clean STRIPS-style model.
audit.prompt: Given the structured descriptions from the action experts, produce a concise report that lists recommended predicate normalizations, identifies and removes bookkeeping shortcuts (for example ephemeral quota tokens, transient markers, or post-hoc penalty predicates), highlights potential causal loops, and suggests deterministic resolution strategies for ambiguous naming.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert integrator and PDDL modeler. Using the structured action analyses and the auditor report, produce a final PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and each problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure predicates, types, and action names are normalized and that actions remain distinct by originating agent.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the provided structured descriptions and audit recommendations to generate a single coherent PDDL domain and at least one PDDL problem that encodes the relevant initial conditions and goals from the use-case scenarios. Target FastDownwards compatibility and include any :requirements that are necessary. Keep agent-specific actions distinct by prefixing action names with the originating agent name when appropriate.
